How about linking other nodes in your writeup? To link, put "[" and "]" around a node name: [Brian Eno] creates a link to Brian Eno. Also, you can use a pipe (|) to designate a title. [Brian Eno|Master of Sound] links to Brian Eno, but looks like this: Master of Sound Use the pipe to reduce the number of dead-end links in your writeups by showing one thing and pointing to another. For example: [fiction|those crazy voices in my head]. You don't even need to have nodes created to make links to them, once you've linked you can create the nodes simply by clicking on them-- the Everything search will give you a list of similar choices...use the pipe to point to these or create a new node!

You have an unlimited amount of space for your writeup...why so short? Tell us more! Try to include some references or "further reading" through hard-links.
